Description: Body fragment of Attic red-figured pottery column-krater. Band of tongues above figured zone which has the head of a woman wearing saccos to right.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 130, no. 360.3, pl. XXXIX)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 236, no. 218) (Labels registration number as 4797)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0981)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4787 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
